Class SystemTrayNotification

java.lang.Object
com.notifications.system_tray_notifications.system_tray.SystemTrayNotification
public class SystemTrayNotification extends Object
This class handles the creation of a system tray notification with customizable options. It allows for displaying notifications, playing sounds, and showing dialogs with custom messages or panels.
Author:
Muath Hassoun

  • Field Details

    • trayIcon

      public static TrayIcon trayIcon
      The TrayIcon object that represents the icon displayed in the system tray. This icon is used to trigger notifications and handle user interactions (e.g., clicks). It is initialized in the `Tray` method and is used to display notifications and the associated popup menu.

    • removeIconAfterAlert

      public static boolean removeIconAfterAlert
      Indicates whether the tray icon should be automatically removed after the alert is shown.

      If set to true, the icon will be removed from the system tray once the alarm or notification is displayed. This is useful for one-time alerts or temporary notifications. If false, the icon remains in the tray until manually removed, or the application exits.

    • systemTray

      public static SystemTray systemTray
      A reference to the system's SystemTray instance.

      This field holds the active system tray used for adding or removing TrayIcon instances. It is initialized when the CreateTrayIcon method is called, if the platform supports system tray functionality.

  • Constructor Details

    • SystemTrayNotification

      public SystemTrayNotification()

  • Method Details

    • CreateTrayIcon

      public static void CreateTrayIcon(Notifications notification_object, AlarmSounds alarm_object, Image trayAlertIcon, boolean useDefaultIcon, boolean addTrayToTaskBar, boolean removeIconAfterAlert)
      Initializes and displays a system tray notification with a custom or default icon, alarm sound, message behavior, and optional taskbar integration.

      This method performs the following operations:

      • Checks if the system tray is supported on the current platform.
      • Loads a default PNG icon from the application resources at /Icon_STN/icon.png.
      • Uses a provided custom icon if useDefaultIcon is false and trayAlertIcon is not null; otherwise, uses the default icon.
      • Creates a TrayIcon with the chosen icon and application title.
      • Associates a popup menu with the tray icon that includes options such as hide, mute, restart, about, and exit.
      • Handles click events on the tray icon to display a dialog with the notification message.
      • Configures and triggers a system tray notification with a sound alert and custom duration, optionally repeating.
      • If addTrayToTaskBar is true, the tray icon is added to the system taskbar.
      • If removeIconAfterAlert is true, the tray icon is removed from the system tray after the alert is shown.

      If the platform does not support system tray notifications or the icon resource cannot be loaded, the method exits silently. Any exceptions are printed using the printErrorMessage utility.

      Parameters:
      notification_object - an instance of Notifications containing the title, message, duration, repeat status, and app settings
      alarm_object - an instance of AlarmSounds used to retrieve and manage the alarm sound
      trayAlertIcon - a custom icon image to be used in the tray (if useDefaultIcon is false)
      useDefaultIcon - if true, the default internal icon is used; otherwise, the provided trayAlertIcon is used if available
      addTrayToTaskBar - if true, the tray icon is added to the system taskbar
      removeIconAfterAlert - if true, the tray icon is automatically removed after the alert is triggered

    • initializeTimer

      public static void initializeTimer(int delay, boolean isRepeating, ActionListener listener)
      Initializes the timer with a given delay, repetition mode, and action listener. If the timer is already initialized, it stops and reinitializes it.
      Parameters:
      delay - The delay in milliseconds between action events.
      isRepeating - true if the timer should repeat, false if it should fire only once.
      listener - The action listener that handles timer events.

    • startTimer

      public static void startTimer()
      Starts the timer if it has been initialized. If the timer is not initialized, an error message is printed to the error stream.

    • stopTimer

      public static void stopTimer()
      Stops the timer if it is running. If the timer is not initialized, an error message is printed to the error stream.

    • isAlive

      public static boolean isAlive()
      Checks if the timer is currently running. If the timer is not initialized, a warning message is printed.
      Returns:
      true if the timer is running, false otherwise.

    • isCoalescing

      public static boolean isCoalescing()
      Checks if the timer is coalescing events. Coalescing means that multiple pending timer events are merged into a single event to prevent event flooding. If the timer is not initialized, a warning message is printed.
      Returns:
      true if the timer is coalescing events, false otherwise.

    • setIsToShowPanel

      public void setIsToShowPanel(boolean isToShowPanel)
      Sets whether the dialog should display a JPanel.
      Parameters:
      isToShowPanel - A boolean value indicating whether to show a JPanel

    • setPanel

      public void setPanel(JPanel panel)
      Sets the JPanel to be displayed in the dialog.
      Parameters:
      panel - The JPanel to be displayed
